text.0: whoso enkindles thee with lifted ladle and thrice this day offers thee food o agni.
text.1: may he excel triumphant through thy splendours wise through thy mental power o jātavedas.
text.2: whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel serving the majesty of mighty agni.
text.3: he kindling thee at evening and at morning prospers and comes to wealth and slays his foemen.
text.4: agni is master of sublime dominion agni is lord of strength and lofty riches.
text.5: straightway the selfreliant god most youthful gives treasures to the mortal who adores him.
text.6: most youthful god whatever sin through folly we here as human beings have committed.
text.7: in sight of aditi make thou us sinless remit entirely agni our offences.
text.8: even in the presence of great sin o agni free us from prison of the gods or mortals.
text.9: never may we who are thy friends be injured grant health and strength unto our seed and offspring.
text.10: even as ye here gods excellent and holy have loosed the cow that by the foot was tethered.
text.11: so also set us free from this affliction long let our life o agni be extended.
